III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Employment policies and procedures
Title
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107
Section A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
Description and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and suitable health, ability, experience, and education to perform
the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/29/24, a youth and a staff were inside a linen closet at the
facility. Another youth was holding the door open, and the staff
closed the door so the youth could not see inside. During this 3-5
minute period, the staff punched the youth three times in the chest
and once in the left side of the face. The youth indicated having a
scratch near his left forearm/wrist area.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint source was interviewed via phone on April 9, 2024.
Complaint Source reported she directly received the specific allegations
from Youth A. She reported Youth A was very specific about the time
frame being three to five minutes within the clothing closet with Staff 1.
Complaint Source reported she was present when Youth A went to be
seen by medical and Youth A’s description of the incident was not
consistent with the story he shared with other staff.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 4, 2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported he feels safe
at the facility except when Staff 1 is working. On March 29, 2024, he and
Youth B asked Staff 1 to get new clothing items out of the clothing
closet. Youth A reported Youth B was holding the door open, and he
went into the clothing closet with Staff 1. He reported for an unknown
reason Youth B walked away from the door and it closed. Youth A
reported Staff 1 got into a fighting stance and said something along the
lines of, “It’s on now.” He reported Staff 1 started to punch him and
Youth A tried to open the door to leave the situation. Youth A reported
Staff 1 punched him a couple of times in the chest, and he tried to hit
Youth A in the head, but Youth A covered his head. He reported he
does not remember how long he was in the closet with Staff 1. Youth A
reported when it stopped, Staff 1 grabbed a clothing item and threw it at
him, and they walked out. He reported when he walked out, he talked to
only his peers about the situation, and they reported they could hear
shoes squeaking in the room. Youth A reported he did not tell any staff
2

about what happened at that time however, reported the situation to
Staff 2 on April 3, 2024. Youth A reported he met with Nurse on April 4,
2024, to get checked and she found a scratch that was already healed.
Youth A was asked what the rule was about getting clothes at the
facility. He reported typically a staff will hold the door open and the youth
will go in to get their clothing items and come immediately back out.
Youth A reported the rule is the door can never be shut due to safety
concerns. He was asked if there were any other concerns with Staff 1
before this situation and he reported about a month ago Staff 1 came
into his room threatening him to fight him. Youth A reported he filed a
grievance and was told the video footage reviewed was not in line with
his story. He reported Staff 1 has also told him and Youth C that when it
comes time for them to discharge that he was going to fight them one-
on-one on the unit. He reported Staff 1 also pinched and poked him with
a pen but did not remember when this occurred. Youth A reported he
does not want Staff 1 working on his unit because that makes him feel
unsafe. He reported there are staff on the unit that he can talk to if he
does not feel safe. Youth A showed this consultant and MDHHS worker
his left wrist where a small scar was observed. He stated there was no
other marks or bruises on his body.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 4, 2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he has had a
positive relationship with Youth A overall, but Youth A will get upset with
him when he is held accountable for his actions. Staff 1 reported on April
3, 2024, Youth A earned a consequence for being disruptive on the unit
and trying to manipulate staff about his points. He reported he was the
staff to provide the consequence to Youth A. Staff 1 was asked about
going into the clothing closet on March 29, 2024, and he reported he
went into the clothing closet because Youth A and Youth B requested
items. He reported when he walked up to the clothing closet door, he
told the youth to back up because he was just going to go in there alone
to grab the items. Staff 1 reported when the door was about to close,
Youth A snuck into the room as the door was closing. He reported when
in the clothing closet, they grabbed items and were out of the room
within five seconds. Staff 1 denied he ever got into a fighting stance,
punched, or stated, “It’s on now” to Youth A. When asked about the
training on the clothing closet, Staff 1 reported if there is a second staff
working to maintain the line of sight of the youth, a staff can go in and
grab the clothing items alone for the youth. He reported the other
practice is staff are to open the door, hold the door open, and allow the
youth to get their items. Staff 1 reported in this situation, Youth A had
snuck into the room. When asked about making threats to Youth A or
Youth C, Staff 1 denied that ever occurred. He reported he has sat with
Youth A to talk about his behaviors, points, and goals but has never
threatened him. Staff 1 reported his goal as a staff is to build the youth
up to help them be successful when it becomes time to be discharged
from the facility. He reported he believed Youth A made this report
because he was upset on April 3, 2024, due to the consequences he
received for being disruptive and trying to manipulate other staff about
his points.
3

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 4, 2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported there has
been nothing out of the ordinary that has occurred in the unit over the
past week. He reported he slightly remembers asking Staff 1 for new
clothes on March 29, 2024. Youth B reported he remembered Staff 1
getting the item for him. He does not remember holding the door open or
who was in the clothing closet room when the door closed. Youth B was
asked if he heard any shoes squeaking in the clothing closet and he
reported he does not remember hearing that. He was asked about Staff
1, and he reported Staff 1 is a strict but nice staff. Youth B reported Staff
1 will hold the youth accountable for their points and behavior. He
reported Staff 1 is fair about the situation but some youth, like Youth A,
will get very upset when they are held accountable. Youth B reported he
has not heard of any youth having any issues with Staff 1. Youth B was
asked what the process is when a youth needs new clothes on the unit,
and reported the youth is to ask staff for the clothing. He reported
sometimes staff will go into the clothing closet themselves to get the
item for the youth but typically the staff will just hold the door open for
the youth to get in and out to get their clothing items. Youth B reported
he does not remember any time being in the closet with the door closed
with a staff. He reported if he did it was only for a quick moment to get
his stuff. Youth B reported he has no concerns about the facility at this
time.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on April 12, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he was working
on March 29, 2024, with Staff 1. He reported the ratio on the unit is one
staff to eight youth and he was focused on his youth. Staff 3 reported he
was sitting across the unit when he heard shoes squeaking and saw
Youth A and Staff 1 walk out of the clothing closet. He reported he did
not think anything of it because Staff 1 and Youth A came out of the
clothing closet laughing and smiling. Staff 3 reported his shoes normally
squeak on the unit when he is walking around. He reported he did not
know Staff 1 and Youth A were in the closet together until he looked up
and saw them walk out. Staff 3 reported he thought it was abnormal that
they were in the room together but sometimes a youth will tell a staff
they want a certain item in the clothing closet and will walk in to show
them. He reported he is a new staff to the facility, so he is not sure about
the proper protocol for the clothing closet, but he noted they are trained
to make sure to stay in sight of the camera when working. He reported
he has no concerns with Staff 1 working on the unit and noted he has
positive interactions with the youth. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 is always
trying to make sure the youth are bettering themselves and has never
seen him get upset or threaten a youth. He reported he does not know
what happened in the clothing closet as he was not in there and stated
he has not heard any complaints from the youth. Staff 3 reported Youth
A gets very focused on his points at the facility and will try to manipulate
the staff to get what he wants.
4

Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 4,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator reported he
was aware of the allegations as Youth A had disclosed it to Staff 2. He
reported Youth A was assessed by Nurse today, April 4, 2024, and there
were no concerns noted of marks or bruising. Administrator reported he
watched the video footage of when Youth A reported he went into the
clothing closet with Staff 1. He reported he saw Youth A follow behind
Staff 1 into the closet and the door shut for less than ten seconds.
Administrator reported staff are trained if there is another staff on the
unit, the staff goes into the clothing closet alone to get the requested
clothing items for the youth, or staff are to stand in the doorway holding
the door open in camera view and allow the youth to grab the item on
their own. Administrator reported there have been no issues with Staff 1
at the facility and noted he holds the youth accountable for their actions,
so sometimes the youth will get frustrated.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 4, 2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported he was aware
of why he was being interviewed and reported it was because Staff 1
fought Youth A in the clothing closet. He reported he knew this
happened because Youth A told him. Youth C reported this occurred on
March 29, 2024. He reported he did not see what happened in the room
but stated he was sitting in the main area and could hear the shoes
squeaking in the clothing closet. Youth C reported Youth A reported he
“body boxed” with Staff 1. He explained body boxing is when people
fight by just doing quick punches to the chest or stomach. Youth C
reported Youth A and Staff 1 were in the closet for fifteen seconds which
is how fast those punches could have happened. He reported when
Youth A and Staff 1 came out of the room there was nothing different.
Youth C reported Staff 1 has never been threatening to him. He reported
when he got into a disagreement with Staff 1 that Staff 1 commented
that they could step into a room for body boxing on his last day at the
facility. Youth C reported he did not take that as a threat. He stated that
he does not have any concerns about the facility.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 4, 2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported he
remembered when Youth A and Staff 1 went into the clothing closet
together on March 29, 2024. He reported he was sitting in the main pod
area. He reported he did hear shoes squeaking but shoes squeak on the
unit all the time because the floors are waxed. Youth D reported he
remembered they were only in the closet for a few seconds and Youth A
came out laughing. He reported he never heard about any assault or
body boxing occurring. Youth D reported he has heard other youth talk
to one another about body boxing but never heard a staff participated in
or threatened to body box a youth. He reported staff on the unit are on
top of redirecting the youth when they are not being appropriate and
maintaining line-of-sight supervision. When asked about asking for new
clothing, Youth D reported sometimes the staff will just go into the closet
and get the item for you or they stand in the door and allow a youth to
grab their items.
5

Nurse was interviewed via phone on April 12, 2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Nurse reported she got called to complete a
medical exam on Youth A due to a report of getting assaulted by a staff.
She reported she had Staff 4 come to the medical room as a witness for
the exam. Nurse reported when she asked Youth A what occurred he
stated a staff grabbed his wrist and scratched him. She reported she
viewed his wrist and there was an older scar on his wrist and there were
no other injuries. Nurse asked Youth A if there were any other concerns
during the exam and he denied. She reported Youth A never disclosed
who the staff was, what happened, or that he was punched. Nurse
reported Youth A does have asthma but during the exam, he never
disclosed any pain or discomfort in his chest or any trouble breathing.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on April 12, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported he is a shift
supervisor and was asked to come be a witness for the medical exam of
Youth A. He reported Youth A complained of his wrist where a tiny scar
was observed. Staff 4 could not remember exactly what Youth A
disclosed about what happened. He was asked about the clothing closet
procedure, and he reported if there are two staff working then one staff
can go into the room solo to get the items for the youth. Staff 4 reported
when a staff is with a youth, they should always be visible via camera for
safety and security. He reported he has had no concerns with Staff 1’s
behaviors with the youth or has heard of any complaints. Staff 4
reported he has worked with Youth A and noted Youth A gets very
focused on his point system. He reported if Youth A gets bad points, he
will retaliate against the staff who gave him those points. Staff 4
reported he had not heard any concerns of body boxing or threats until
this investigation.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 4, 2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported on April 3,
2024, during bedtime, Youth A was having escalating behaviors
because of his points. She reported Youth A kept yelling how Staff 1 had
it out for him and Staff 2 had to continue to verbally redirect him to calm
down. Staff 2 reported Youth A was not making any sense because his
emotions were so high and he was yelling. She stated he did mention
something about Staff 1 hitting him before in the clothing closet, but she
could not get any information, which is why she did not call in a report
due to the limited details and no concerns were noted of marks or
bruises. Staff 2 reported she planned to talk to Youth A in the morning
about the situation but when she came in it was reported there was an
open investigation with Staff 1 and Youth A. She reported she has not
had any concerns with Staff 1 and he holds youth accountable for their
actions. Staff 2 reported Youth A struggles with being held accountable
and getting consequences. When asked about the protocol for when a
youth asks for clothing, she reported if there is proper staffing then a
staff can go get the clothing item for the youth alone. Staff 2 reported a
staff can also hold the door open, stand in the doorway in view of the
camera, and allow the youth to go grab their requested clothing.
6

Probation Officer was interviewed on April 9, 2024- Probation Officer
reported she has not heard any concerns from Youth A about staff
threatening him or being assaulted. Probation Officer reported she does
not have any concerns with the facility and reported the facility keeps
her informed of Youth A’s behaviors. She reported Youth A does have a
history of lying and will try to manipulate people to get his way.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on April 4, 2024, in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. This consultant and MDHHS Worker walked through
Alpha Pod where the incident was alleged to have occurred. When
walking on the pod this consultant’s shoes did make squeaking noises
due to the floor being waxed. The clothing closet room was viewed, and
the door had to be unlocked by Administrator. Within the clothing closet
there was racks with clothing and when walking around the closet this
consultant’s shoes made a squeaking noise.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Video Footage from March 29, 2024, from 18:40-18:42- At
18:41, Youth A, Youth B, and Staff 1 walked towards the clothing
closet. Staff 1 unlocked the door; Youth A is straight behind him
and Youth B is behind and to the right. Staff 1 entered the door
with his back to Youth A as the door was closing Youth A slipped
into the room behind Staff 1. Youth B continued to stand in his
same spot outside the door. The door of the clothing closet
closed at 18:42:03 and reopens at 18:42:09. Youth A opened the
door and Staff 1 threw him a shirt as he walked out. Youth B
remained by the door still and Staff 1 handed him socks when he
exited the clothing closet.
- Nursing Note dated April 4, 2024- This nursing note was
completed by Nurse. She met with Youth A on April 4, 2024, at
8:37am due to complaints of being assaulted by Staff 1. The
nursing note reports there was no scratches observed, Youth A
reported no pain, and there was no bruising noted. Nurse looked
at Youth A’s left wrist as he indicated the mark on his wrist was
from the incident with Staff 1. Nurse explained to Youth A the
mark on his wrist was an older scar that has been healed.
- Facility Policy-In Unit Security- This policy notes that clothing
rooms, supply closets, and/or mop closest must be locked
immediately after use. There was no policy noting of what steps
need to be taken with the clothing closet when a youth asks for
clothing as it pertains to only staff going in there or staff are to
hold the door open and let the youth walk in.
- Facility Policy- Discipline, Use of Physical Force, Managing
Behavior Control System- This policy notes, “Corporal
punishment in any form (striking a resident, making a resident
stand in an awkward position or do push-ups, withholding of
7

meals, etc.) is unacceptable as a method of discipline or control.
A Youth Specialist’s use of corporal punishment is grounds for
disciplinary actions up to and including dismissal for
employment.”
- Incident report dated April 3, 2024, at 10:28pm-This incident
report was completed by Staff 1. At bedtime, Youth A had been
throwing a stress ball at his door extremely hard to where it was
considered disruptive to other’s sleeping. Staff 1 redirected him
about the disruption and Youth A then continued to ask about his
points. He started to punch and bang his door which earned him
a consequence. Youth A continued to be verbally escalated over
his points.
- Grievance Form dated February 5, 2024- This grievance form
was completed by Youth A who reported Staff 1 had come and
threatened him and his peer on February 4, 2024. Youth A
reported Staff 1 said he was going to come to their rooms and
fight them. He reported when he said that Youth A started to
scream and Staff 1 told him to shut up and slammed his door.
Administrator reviewed video footage and did not find any video
footage to support the allegations.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- There is no disciplinary action
listed within Staff 1’s file. Staff 1 is up to date on all required
trainings. Staff 1 completed training on Unit and Building Security
on January 17, 2024, Horseplay policy on March 20, 2024,
Resident Management policy on January 20, 2024, and Physical
Management on December 21, 2023.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. The video footage reviewed
showed Staff 1 going into the clothing closet with his back to the
youth and Youth A getting into the clothing closet as the door was
closing. They were within the clothing closet for six seconds.
There was no marks or bruises found on Youth A during his
medical exam. Staff 1 denied this occurred and Youth A’s
accounts of the incident changed.
Technical Assistance
Technical Assistance is offered to the facility that their security
policy reflects what they are training staff on for safety and
security. Staff reported they have been trained to go into the
clothing closet alone when there is another staff on shift or to
allow a youth to go in the clothing closet while staff hold the door
open within sight of the camera for safety. This training was not
reflected within the security policy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
8

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
